citation.article-title: Alkaliphilic heliobacterium Heliorestis baculata sp. nov. and emended description of the genus Heliorestis.

p.s: Description of Heliorestis baculata sp. nov.
Heliorestis baculata (ba.cu.la'ta. L. adj. baculatus rod-shaped; Heliorestis baculata, a rod-shaped solar rope)
Cells straight or slightly curved rods measuring 0.6–1 μm in diameter by 6–10 μm long.
Motile by peritrichous flagella.
Phototrophic: absorption maxima of intact cells at 788, 671, 575, 413, and 370 nm.
Grows phototrophically on acetate, pyruvate, and lactate.
No growth is observed under dark chemotrophic conditions at the expense of pyruvate fermentation.
Biotin is required as a growth factor; a small amount of yeast extract is highly stimulatory.
Highly tolerant to sulfide (up to 3 mM) oxidizing it to elemental sulfur and polysulfides under photoheterotrophic conditions.
Photoautotrophic growth does not occur.
Obligately alkaliphilic: pH range for growth 8–10.2, optimum 8.5–9.5.
Requires sodium carbonates in growth medium.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0.2–2% sodium carbonates with optimal concentration 0.5–1%.
Non-halophilic, but growth is possible with up to 3% NaCl in the presence of 0.5% sodium carbonates.
Optimum growth temperature 30°C.
G+C content of DNA 45.0 mol% (Tm).
Phylogenetic position within the low G+C gram-positive bacteria.
Habitat: alkaline shoreline, flooded soils of steppe soda lakes.
Type strain: OS-H1T, isolated from the shoreline soil of Lake Ostozhe located in the steppe of South Chita region (Southeast Siberia, Russia).
Deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen GmbH (DSMZ) as DSM 13446.
